scenarios.name: Create Formula Metric with Weekly Cadence and Custom Target
scenarios.description: This end-to-end scenario verifies the successful creation of a new metric using the Formula Builder with a weekly cadence, adding it to the dashboard, and configuring a 4-level Custom Target.
user_journey: Navigate to the Application URL.
Enter the user's email address and click 'Continue'.
Enter the user's password and click 'Login'.
Select the specified company from the list.
Navigate to 'Administration' > 'Manage Users'.
Click 'Invite Users' and enter the new user's email and set admin privileges.
Click 'Send Invite'.
In the 'Pending Invitations' section, click the checkmark to accept the invitation for the new user.
Fill in the First Name, Last Name, and create a Password for the new user.
Click 'Accept Invite' to complete the user creation.
Navigate to the 'Metrics' page from the main navigation.
Click the 'Add Metric' button.
Enter the metric name.
Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
In the Formula Builder, search for and select the first metric.
Select a mathematical operator (e.g., '+').
Search for and select the second metric.
Verify the complete formula is displayed correctly.
Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
Select 'Weekly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
Verify the 'Resets On' dropdown appears and select a day of the week.
Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
Navigate to 'Dashboards' > 'My Dashboard'.
Click the 'Edit KPI' icon to open the modal.
Locate the newly created metric in the left panel and click it to add it to the right panel.
Click the 'Save' button in the modal.
Hover over the newly added metric card on the dashboard to reveal the three-dot menu.
Click the three-dot menu button and then click the 'Edit' option.
On the Edit page, select the 'Target' tab.
Select the 'Custom' radio button.
Enter values for Level 1, Level 2, Level 3, and Level 4 target fields.
Click the 'Save' button to save the target configuration.
Verify the page navigates back to the dashboard.
acceptance_criteria: User successfully logs in and selects the correct company.
A new user is successfully invited and their account is created.
A new metric is created with a value source of 'Formula'.
The 'Resets On' field is visible and configurable when cadence is 'Weekly'.
The new metric is successfully added to the 'My KPIs' section of the dashboard.
The user can successfully navigate to the metric's Edit page from the dashboard card.
The Custom Target is successfully configured with four performance levels.
After saving, the metric card on the dashboard displays the configured Custom Target visual indicators.

scenarios.name: Create Metric from Existing Metric with Quarterly Cadence
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies that a user can create a new metric by selecting an existing metric as its source, configure a quarterly cadence, and add it to the dashboard successfully.
user_journey: Navigate to the Application URL.
Enter the user's email address and click 'Continue'.
Enter the user's password and click 'Login'.
Select the specified company from the list.
Navigate to the 'Metrics' page from the main navigation.
Click the 'Add Metric' button.
Enter the metric name.
Select 'Metric' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
Search for and select an existing metric from the search/dropdown field.
Select 'Quarterly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
Navigate to 'Dashboards' > 'My Dashboard'.
Click the 'Edit KPI' icon to open the modal.
Locate the newly created metric in the left panel and click it to add it to the right panel.
Click the 'Save' button in the modal.
acceptance_criteria: User successfully logs in and selects the correct company.
The metric creation form correctly displays the metric selection interface when 'Metric' is chosen as the value source.
A new metric is successfully created using an existing metric as its source.
The new metric is configured with a 'Quarterly' cadence.
The newly created metric appears on the 'My Dashboard' in the 'My KPIs' section after being added.

test_data_requirements.Metric_to_Select: [Name of a pre-existing metric to use as source]

dependencies: The test user account must exist and have permissions to access the specified company.
The application must have at least two existing metrics with numeric values for the Formula Builder scenarios to work.
The 'My Dashboard' must be accessible and the 'My KPIs' section must be present.
The user invitation workflow must be functional for the first scenario.
